page.title: 17FARMING
page.content: The main industry around Usk is farming of{crops, cattle and sheep.} The area is a good livestock area. It grows fine crops of grass, this is because the soil is of old red sandstone with a reasonable rainfall. There are also some cereal and potato crops grown in the valley.These are somewhat restricted though by flooding of fields near the river. This happens on average about 3 times a year.The livestock are kept for milk and meat production. Several herds of friesian cows produce milk.Some of these cows are crossed with beef breeds e.g.{Hereford}and{Charolais,}to produce calves which are reared and fattened for{beef.}There are large numbers of sheep on the slopes above the valley. These are mainly hill type breeds of animal e.g.{Welsh Mountain} and{Radnor Hill.
